roles.title: Task-Agnostic Step (TAS) extractor (flash)
roles.description: Deconstruct the high-level goal of creating the API-driven Humor Evaluator into a clear, sequential, and actionable task plan for the team.

roles.title: Engineer
roles.description: Implement the full-stack application, focusing on creating a robust API client for https://ai.violass.club/v1, building the user interface based on the designer's specifications, and integrating the prompt-driven logic.

roles.title: Prompt Engineer
roles.description: Develop, test, and refine all LLM prompts for joke generation, feedback analysis, and personalized recommendations, ensuring they are optimized for the https://ai.violass.club/v1 API.

roles.title: Designer
roles.description: Generate aesthetic layouts, color palettes, typography, and UI flows for the Humor Evaluator, ensuring an intuitive and accessible user experience for joke interaction and feedback.

steps.name: uTASe
steps.task: Deconstruct the high-level goal into a sequence of actionable tasks for implementing the Humor Evaluator system with the specified API.

steps.name: Kodax
steps.task: Investigate the `https://ai.violass.club/v1` API documentation to determine authentication methods, request/response formats, and any rate limits. Create a preliminary technical plan for integration.

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Collaborate with the Engineer to understand API constraints and draft initial prompt structures for joke generation and feedback analysis that are compatible with the target API.

steps.name: Aurora
steps.task: Design the user interface and user flow for the Humor Evaluator. This includes screens for displaying jokes, collecting user ratings/feedback, and showing personalized recommendations.

steps.name: Kodax
steps.task: Develop a modular and reusable API client in the chosen programming language to handle all communications with the `https://ai.violass.club/v1` endpoint.

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Finalize and test the core set of prompts for generating jokes, analyzing user feedback, and making recommendations. Use a testing tool to validate prompt effectiveness directly with the API.

steps.name: Kodax
steps.task: Implement the front-end UI based on the Designer's specifications, creating components for joke display, feedback input, and recommendation lists.

steps.name: Kodax
steps.task: Integrate the API client and the finalized prompts into the application's backend logic. Connect the front-end UI to trigger the appropriate API calls and display the results.

steps.name: Lyra
steps.task: Conduct an end-to-end review of the integrated system, analyzing the quality of the LLM's outputs and iteratively refining the prompts to improve performance and user satisfaction.

steps.name: Kodax
steps.task: Perform final integration testing, bug fixing, and prepare the complete Humor Evaluator application for deployment.
